intro: Seseli transsilvanicum, commonly known as Transylvanian seseli, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided, contributing to its ornamental appeal, while its roots are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Seseli transsilvanicum plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations due to its nectar-rich flowers.
